title: Reduce Puro roleplay and shift assistant responses to a neutral chat style

requirements.text: Update the backend response generator so the assistant no longer strongly roleplays as Puro, producing neutral, helpful conversational replies instead of in-character mannerisms (e.g., remove roleplay stage directions like "(tail wags)" and immersion/roleplay framing like "Puro sees you ..."). Action messages (user text ending with "*") must still be recognized and handled, but the response should acknowledge the described action in a neutral way.

quotes: Make the roleplay chat not really roleplay to puro

acceptanceCriteria: Sending a normal dialogue message results in an assistant reply that does not include Puro roleplay mannerisms (e.g., no "(tail wags)"-style additions) and does not speak as a character roleplaying Puro.

Sending an action message (a message ending in "*") is still stored as messageType=action (with the trailing "*" removed from stored content) and the assistant reply acknowledges the action content in a neutral style without immersion/roleplay exposition.
The canister method signatures and stored ChatMessage schema remain compatible with the current frontend (no breaking candid/interface changes).

requirements.text: Update user-facing copy in the chat UI to remove roleplay-first phrasing that encourages talking "to Puro" and instead present the experience as a general chat assistant while keeping the existing action-message hint ("*" at the end for actions).

quotes: Make the roleplay chat not really roleplay to puro

acceptanceCriteria: The empty state text no longer says "Say hello to Puro!" and is rewritten in English to invite a general conversation while still mentioning the "*" action convention.
The header/subtitle text no longer positions the bot as an in-character roleplay companion (e.g., replace "Your friendly companion" with neutral wording such as "Chat assistant" or similar).
No changes are made to any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if state/stable structure changes are required (not expected for this change).
Keep the existing action parsing behavior: user messages ending with "*" must still be treated as actions and rendered as actions in the UI.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or other paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not add third-party AI/LLM integrations.
Do not remove the Puro avatar asset or redesign the entire UI theme beyond updating roleplay-oriented copy.
